turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: Shut up Micheal.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: I KILLED MY BROTHER!

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: You see for me it's over. Over baby. I'm gonna turn myself in. After the wedding of course. After the wedding. Out of respect.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: I don't think that's a good idea.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: I said out of respect. Respect for you Fisher. For you and your wedding and your beautiful bride. There will be no more rain. You see where I am here?

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: I'll come to you tonight.

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: No, the children sleep with me.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Give them to Refugio.

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: No, I don't want to because they yell. And I've got news for you too.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Then I'll get you in the fields tomorrow ...

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Keep quiet. These miserable brats only get in the way.

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: You'd like me to kill them?

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Didn't you say you know how to make vanilla pudding?

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: Yes, yes.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Stop this, stop this.

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: Let me go, Don Amalio, I'll tear her apart.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Where's the camera?

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: It's a present from my parents.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: So much the better. We'll all fit. How many floors are there?

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: Two.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Are there many windows?

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: Lots. It's got balconies and two big towers.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Then it's a respectable house.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: When I wasn't so miserable I used to sell pigs. Begging your pardon, I was more honest than my holy Mother.

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: So you didn't come from the poorhouse!

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: No, miss. Smoking makes him spit and feel ill.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Smoking makes me feel ill? It's these filthy fag ends. I won't mention in this company what's upsetting you.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: They've got a real hen house here! You can't hear yourself speak.

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: Tell me the answer to this! What bird lays eggs in a barn?

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: Don Amalio!

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: Enedina and Paco ...

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: What about them?

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: They're playing games behind the couch ...

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Which couch?

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: That one.

turns.speaker: DON AMALIO
turns.text: Take me there.

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: Really, Don AMALIO, there's not much point in making a fuss.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Yes, Uncle. How are you?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: I'm well ... The bus was late, wasn't it? ... What was the journey like?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Excellent. What a charming, peaceful place, Uncle.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: You'll think you're still at the convent.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: How long are you staying?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: A very short while, Uncle. I've been given permission to stay only a few days.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Was that difficult to get?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: No. Mother Superior told me to come.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Did you have so little interest in seeing me?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: To tell you the truth, not very much. I cannot lie. I respect you and I am grateful to you because I owe you everything materially, but otherwise ...

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: You have no feelings toward ...

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: You've been neglecting the farm, Uncle.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: In twenty years the grass has invaded everything. There are spiders all over the house except on the first floor. I hardly ever go out.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Come down here, you scamp.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Who is she?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: My maid Ramona's daughter. She's a little animal.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Come down.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: How like your aunt you are, even in your walk.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I know, Uncle, you've told me that already.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: You see, even the voice.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I'm going to make you a nun's cake. It will make your mouth water.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: You are spoiling me too much. I won't know what to do with myself when you've gone.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Only because you want it.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Nothing. I didn't say anything.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: How did you know about that?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Oh, some years ago I heard my mother talking about it. But is it true?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Don't you ever see him?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: How could anybody behave like that?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Sometimes these things happen because of inexperience. Sometimes it's because of...

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Evil.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: And what do you know about life? When all is said and done you couldn't possibly understand.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: His mother wanted to keep him. She came from a poor family. I was in love with your aunt. I would like to have acknowledged him but I was afraid of losing her. That's why I didn't say anything.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: And this innocent child.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Don't worry. He won't be forgotten.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: You must think I am a monster.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: No, but what a pity life is like that.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: No, Uncle; ashes mean penance and death.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Then it's penance for you who are going to be a nun; and for me, who am old, it's death ...

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: If you like, I will come with you tomorrow to the village when you leave.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Thank you, Uncle.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: This evening we must do something special by way of a farewell.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Whatever you like.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: I should like you to do something for me. It's an innocent sort of thing but I'm very set on it.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Today I can refuse you nothing.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: How strange you are! When I asked you to do this favor for me you refused. You seemed almost offended. And now, here you are, making me so very happy all of a sudden. Thank you, my child!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I don't like masquerading, but as you see I decided to give in to your whim.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: You must think I'm mad.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: No, Uncle, and now I'm pleased to have been able to do this favor, because, although I didn't think so at first, you are really a good man.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: If you only knew ... When I was young I was full of idealism. I wanted to do something on a big scale for others, something to show my great love for humanity. But as soon as I tried to do something about it, I became afraid that I would be laughed at and I felt like a fool ... and so I went back into my shell.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Wasn't that cowardice?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: No, it isn't that, I can assure you. I wouldn't be afraid in the face of real danger. I've proved that to myself. On the other hand, if a stranger visited me simply to say hello, I'd be alarmed.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Uncle, you mustn't think that I won't be sad to leave you.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: It's up to you entirely. Don't leave, then ...

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Unfortunately ...

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: It's my fault. If I'd come to see you more often, if I'd invited you here for holidays, maybe everything would be different.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Maybe ...

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Yes, I don't want you ever to leave this house.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: You must be out of your mind. I've been so happy these last few days -- now you've spoiled it all.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Leave us alone, Ramona.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Don't go!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: You're lying.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: No, it's true.  Last night when you were sleeping, I had you all to myself.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Think about it. Don't hurry. Think it over.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Go away! Leave me alone.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Let me pass!

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: You must listen to me before you go.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I've listened to you long enough. Let me out.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: All that I said just now was a lie. I said it so you wouldn't leave. I only molested you in my thoughts ... I can't bear to have you leave me, hating me like this.  Tell me you believe what I'm saying and I'll let you go.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: You disgust me... even if what you say is true.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Then you won't forgive me?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Leave me now. You can go to bed.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Yes, sir. Good night.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Why don't you ask her to stay on for a few days?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: I have asked her but she's ungrateful. Sometimes I feel like hitting her. When I talk to her about the convent, she turns to stone.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Sit down, I'm going to need your help.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Sit down, woman, sit down.  You like me, don't you?

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: I'd be really ungrateful, if I didn't like you, sir; you took me and my little girl in when I didn't know where to turn.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Yes, yes, but there's no need to bring that up. How far are you prepared to help me?

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Just say the word, sir, and I'll do anything.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Why don't you speak to her, Ramona? Women are good at that sort of thing. Think of something that will make her stay a few more days.  You are kind, Ramona! Speak to her. I know I don't need to offer you anything, but, if you're successful in this, I'll not forget you or your little girl.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: But sir, what can I say to her? And why should she pay any attention to what a servant tells her?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: The way she looked at me, Ramona! She hates me now. I think I've made a great mistake. She's going away, she's going away and nothing will stop her.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Speak to her again. Explain everything to her seriously.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: What for? She'll only look at me that way again ... I couldn't. You go. Perhaps she'll listen to you. Try to convince her.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: But what can I say to her, sir?

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Tell her I lied, that I didn't take advantage of her.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: You believe me, don't you?

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: DON JAIME
turns.text: Don't lie. You don't believe me either.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: It's only that ... It's all very odd, sir.

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: What will the lady say?

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: She won't even know.

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: If everybody agrees, but to make a roast takes four hours.

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: Is it all right?

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: Enedina's going to take a picture. So we'll have a souvenir.

turns.speaker: ENEDINA
turns.text: They told us you'd be back tomorrow ...

turns.speaker: POCA
turns.text: I didn't want to do it, Don Jorge. They made me ...

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: How much is that?

turns.speaker: FOREMAN
turns.text: Fifteen yards.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: That's fifteen by seven?

turns.speaker: FOREMAN
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: FOREMAN
turns.text: Have you thought of what you want planted yet?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: The fields have been left so long; with a good manuring anything will grow.

turns.speaker: FOREMAN
turns.text: It's for wheat. We've always grown maize in the strip above the vegetables.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: And in the vegetable plot?

turns.speaker: FOREMAN
turns.text: That's good land.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Hold on, Ramon! Is there time to make another trip?

turns.speaker: FOREMAN
turns.text: No, sir, it's nearly six o'clock.  Okay, let's get a move on!  When are you leaving?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Tonight, but I'll be back tomorrow afternoon.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: HOBBLY
turns.text: Come on, miss. Just so the Virgin can be really pretty.

turns.speaker: HOBBLY
turns.text: It won't take but a minute. It's a votive offering for a lady who was cured just when she was dying of fever. Our Lady of the Helpless granted her a favor.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Do you have great devotion for the Virgin?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: It's very good.

turns.speaker: HOBBLY
turns.text: Thank you; but it's missing something.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: That doesn't matter; I like it.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: My God, what have you done to him!

turns.speaker: HOBBLY
turns.text: He was asking for it.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: But why? Why?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Ramona! Ramona!

turns.speaker: HOBBLY
turns.text: Quiet, my dove. Quiet, or I'll ...

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: Not in that way; you're always looking for company.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Why do you say that? Perhaps the young girl is a bit jealous.

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: Why the bad temper?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: It's Viridiana. She's getting on my nerves.

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: She's mad.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: No, not mad at all: she's rotten with religion.

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: Let her do what she wants. She doesn't bother us in any way. She minds her business and we ...

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: So, Ramona!

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: Run and get something to mop it up with, quickly.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: If you wake first, wake me up.

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: What I do every day, but I want to do it earlier.

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: You're happy, aren't you!

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Shouldn't I be? You, on the other hand ...

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: I'm bored. I'm alone all day and I don't know what to do.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: You should have enough to do in this house ... Come here and listen to this.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: What are you thinking about?

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: That your cousin is more to your taste.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: She isn't my cousin.

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: It doesn't make any difference what she is: you like her.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: How in hell does it wind up?

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: I think I'd better go tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Don't be a fool! Why rush away from something which couldn't happen?

turns.speaker: LUCIA
turns.text: You see how much you like her?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: That's life. Some people are brought together, others are separated. What can we do, if that's the way it happens?

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: Maybe afterwards he'll let me ...

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: If you free me, you'll be a rich man ...

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: Me, rich? Come on!

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: There's plenty of money in this house. Piles of it.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: I don't want you to untie me. Kill him and then I'll give you the money.

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: Where's the dough?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Kill him and I'll tell you. If I don't keep my word, you can kill me too. There are thousands of pesetas. Kill him, idiot!

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Kill him.

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: That will teach you not to bother me any more, you son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: He was very good. Better than some people would think.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Why did he kill himself?

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: I don't know, sir.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: One shouldn't be alone the whole time.  I'm not like him, am I?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: And this chest?

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: There are some curtains and drapes, but they're all very old.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: I don't know; I can't remember. But I'm sure he loved you.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: You wouldn't be here otherwise.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: These chairs are in good condition. With a little varnish and some new covers this one will be quite presentable.

turns.speaker: RAMONA
turns.text: I don't know -- they've always been there.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: That's stupid! Plaster! It can still be used.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Miss Viridiana ...

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Are you Jorge?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Jorge, Don Jaime's son, at your service.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I've been expecting you; I got a letter from the lawyer.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Jorge. You frightened me. What's happening to you?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: It's about time we spoke to each other, isn't it?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Well... is it so urgent?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: If I wait until tomorrow, it'll be the same as yesterday and the day before and all the other days. When you're not with your poor people, you're praying or you disappear, I never see you.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I don't know anything about these things, Jorge ...

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: But you have a right to let us know what you think.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I'm not interested. Do what you think's best.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: What do you know about me?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I know that you used to work with an architect.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: And do you know that my mother and I had to suffer? If my father had bothered himself a little more about us, I'd be an architect now.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: I don't understand how you can like being alone so much.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I'm not like you, you have your wife.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: What are you doing here? Get out.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Leave him alone.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: You won't get much done with those people. Those times are over! You ought to let me kick them out.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Do they worry you that much, then?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: They worry me a great deal, and especially because of you.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: There's no point in helping some of them when there are so many others.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I know perfectly well how little I can do. What I want to do is give passing beggars a roof, some food, and a bit of human warmth.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Is that all you're going to devote your life to?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I'm not sure yet. I've had a shock recently, and I'm only beginning to get over it. Perhaps I'll go back to the convent one day.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Are they going to work here too?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Don't worry. Nobody's going to disturb you.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Don't forget the meeting with the lawyer. The car will pick you up tomorrow morning.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I'll be ready.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Do you intend to stay here for some time?

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Yes. Why?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: You can come and live again in the big house if you want. Now that I'm alone, I can settle down anywhere.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: And ...your friend?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: She's left.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Is she coming back?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: PEASANT
turns.text: It's for people!

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Then let him go and he'll follow you.

turns.speaker: PEASANT
turns.text: And let him get run over by somebody else?

turns.speaker: PEASANT
turns.text: He's good at rabbiting and he knows it. When we're in the country, if he doesn't hunt he doesn't get fed.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: How much do you want for him?

turns.speaker: PEASANT
turns.text: I wasn't thinking of selling him, but if you want ... I'll leave it to you.

turns.speaker: PEASANT
turns.text: And remember, the less he eats, the better he runs.

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: What's he called?

turns.speaker: PEASANT
turns.text: Canelo!

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: They're varicose veins, miss, but some days I can't take care of them.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Are you sure it isn't contagious?

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: They told me it isn't at the hospital.

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: They're varicose veins. It isn't leprosy.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: I'll take him to the doctor tomorrow. Come on now, sit down and go on eating. And you, look after him as if he were a sick brother. Be understanding. Now finish eating and then go to bed. Everyone in bed by eight o'clock!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: How are you today?

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: Things seem to be getting better.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Hold your arm out. You can't hope to be cured quickly. You heard what the doctor said. If it had been seen to in time ...This'll take time. But with the help of God, we'll pull through.

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Are your parents alive?

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: Parents? Nobody cares a damn, what's the use of them!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Don't say that.

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: Right, I won't say that, but I still think they're no use.

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: You'll soon find out, you liar!

turns.speaker: VIRIDIANA
turns.text: Stop this!

turns.speaker: LEPER
turns.text: He's lying through his ass!
